title: Citi Czech Republic's Corporate Social Responsibility Activities in 2013
summary: Prague - Citi was actively involved in a broad range of projects in the fields of financial literacy, development of the non-profit sector and charity activities pursued in cooperation with non-profit organizations in the Czech Republic last year. In 2013, Citi supported corporate social responsibility (CSR) activities, which form an integral part of Citi's corporate culture and are among the bank's core values, on a local basis with support of more than CZK 4.5 million.
tag-1: Citi Czech Republic's Corporate Social Responsibility Activities in 2013
tag-3: Prague – Citi was actively involved in a broad range of projects in the fields of financial literacy, development of the non-profit sector and charity activities pursued in cooperation with non-profit organizations in the Czech Republic last year. In 2013, Citi supported corporate social responsibility (CSR) activities, which form an integral part of Citi's corporate culture and are among the bank's core values, on a local basis with support of more than CZK 4.5 million.
tag-4: "We work on our corporate social responsibility projects with many non-profit organizations," says Michal Nebeský, Citi Country Officer for the Czech Republic. "Last year, we started a new project focused on improving the financial literacy of mothers and women living in shelters together with the Tereza Maxová Foundation. The goal of the project is to address their difficult current situation, help them regain control of their lives, and in particular prevent situations where children are taken away from mothers for financial reasons, which we find undesirable."
tag-6: Citi has been focusing on financial education in the long-term perspective, supporting various efforts through grants provided by its CSR arm, the Citi Foundation. The bank has been working with selected partners from among non-profit organizations in this field for a long time. Last year, the Citi Foundation contributed CZK 3,700,000 to Czech non-profit efforts.
tag-8: Citi in the Czech Republic has its own local Employee Charity Fund to which employees contribute on a voluntary basis. The finances in the fund consist of employee contributions which are then matched by the same amount by the bank, and are distributed twice a year to non-profit organizations active in the Czech Republic that meet the formal requirements and submit an official application for support. More than CZK 9 million has been distributed since the inception of the fund in 1996, and 22 projects were supported with CZK 722,000 last year. Support is provided primarily to smaller non-profit organizations, children's shelters and specialized schools operating on the local or regional level.
tag-10: Last June was dedicated to volunteering at Citi. Citi's traditional annual "Global Community Day" volunteering project offered employees in the Czech Republic volunteering opportunities on various days throughout the month. More than 150 employees volunteered for the 20 projects with 15 organizations in nine towns and cities across the country.
tag-11: Twice a year, the bank organizes charity sales exhibits where employees can purchase products from sheltered workshops. Before Easter and Christmas, non-profit organizations offer decorative items and small gifts at Citi's headquarters, and the proceeds from every sales exhibit regularly amount to about CZK 40,000.
tag-13: Citi donated CZK 200,000 to the fundraising account of the People In Need humanitarian organization as part of the Czech Philharmonic's fundraiser concert intended to help people who were affected by the floods. Volunteers from among the bank's employees also helped to restore areas damaged by the floods.

tag-17: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations.
